title: Design: Pair Assignment in Flight Plans (Explicit vs Fluid)
targets: How should pair assignments work in flight steps?
Should masks be locked to personas or fluid?
What's the right balance of structure vs flexibility?

stories.i_want: clear guidance on how to pair for different work
stories.so_that: we know who works together and what perspectives they bring

stories.i_want: to understand why certain pairs work together
stories.so_that: I can adapt when the standard pair isn't available

steps.title: UNA clarifies: What problem are we solving with pair assignments?
BRO proposes: Explicit assignment (pair locked to step, masks locked to personas)
ROOT adds: Fluid assignment (pair chosen at startup, renegotiated as needed)
UNA identifies tension: Explicit is clear (onboarding), fluid is adaptive (reality)
BRO challenges: Can we get both? Explicit framework, fluid execution?
ROOT synthesizes: Use default assignments (explicit), allow override (fluid)
UNA documents the decision: Why this design, what problems it solves, what constraints remain
BRO sketches implementation: What data structure, how does system enforce/suggest?
